intro: Callirhoe lineariloba, commonly known as the slender callirhoe, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its linear, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stems, giving it a distinctive appearance. Callirhoe lineariloba is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
